actions

Class ActionSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Action>
          • actions.ActionSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Action>, Collection<Action>, List<Action>, RandomAccess

    public class ActionSet
extends ArrayList<Action>
    An ActionSet acts like an ArrayList for actions, except it allows for sampling from the list on a Distribution.
    Author:
    Matt
    See Also:
    Action, ActionQueue, IActionGenerator, Distribution, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • samplingDist

        public Distribution<Action> samplingDist

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionSet

        public ActionSet(Distribution<Action> samplingDist)
        Create a new ActionSet which can sample according to the rules of a Distribution. It may otherwise be treated as an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        samplingDist - Distribution that samples of the action set will be pulled when calling sampleDistribution().

    • Method Detail

      • getRandom

        public Action getRandom()
        Get an element from this ActionSet at random.
        Returns:
        A random element of this ActionSet.
        See Also:
        Distribution.randSample(List)

      • sampleDistribution

        public Action sampleDistribution()
        Get a random sample from the defined distribution.
        Returns:
        An action sampled from this ActionSet according to its defined Distribution.

      • getCopy

        public ActionSet getCopy()
        Duplicate this ActionSet, producing a copy with the same Action elements and same sampling Distribution.
        Returns:
        A getCopy of this ActionSet.

      • makeActionSet

        @Deprecated
public static ActionSet makeActionSet(Integer[] durations,
                                                  boolean[][] keys,
                                                  Distribution<Action> dist)
        Deprecated. 
        Get an ActionSet defined by as many durations as desired, 4 keys for each, and a sampling distribution. This is equivalent to just making actions and adding them with ArrayList.add(Object).
        Parameters:
        durations - Timestep durations of the actions which will be in the returned ActionSet.
        keys - 2D array of QWOP keypress statuses. First dimension corresponds to the action, while the second dimension corresponds to a QwOP key.
        dist - Sampling distribution for the new ActionSet.
        Returns:
        A new ActionSet.

      • makeActionSet

                                      boolean[][] keys,
                                      Distribution<Action> dist)

      • replicateKeyString

        @Deprecated
public static boolean[][] replicateKeyString(boolean[] keyString,
                                                         int times)
        Deprecated. 
        Simply return many instances of the given keyString. Useful when making action sets sometimes.
        Parameters:
        keyString - Boolean array representing QWOP keys.
        times - Number of times to replicate the given keyString in the 1st dimension.
        Returns:
